title: Todd Maiden
content:
Yellow Corp. has entered agreements to sell four terminals for $6.1 million as its liquidation process nears its end.

DSV announced it will sell USA Truck, an Arkansas-based truckload carrier, as it does not align with the Danish freight forwarder’s asset-light business model.

Knight-Swift Transportation’s third-quarter results and fourth-quarter outlook came in light of expectations on Wednesday.

Forward Air’s stock fell sharply on Monday following a report that it hasn’t yet received a satisfactory takeover offer.

Old Dominion Freight Line is the latest less-than-truckload carrier to implement a general rate increase ahead of schedule.

Cost reductions at J.B. Hunt more than offset a soft demand environment in the third quarter.

Shares of J.B. Hunt surged in after-hours trading on Wednesday after the company posted better-than-expected third-quarter results.

Prologis sees signs that the logistics warehouse market is tightening, with the potential for rents to see outsized growth in the next upcycle.

Logistics real estate investment trust Prologis beat third-quarter consensus expectations amid “record leasing” activity.

Less-than-truckload rates maintain record levels despite softness across the manufacturing complex.

The truckload market took share for a second straight month in September, but overall freight fundamentals remain weak, according to a report from Cass Information Systems.

Industry veteran-led startup CoPilot announced its initial acquisition as it works toward establishing a global logistics platform.

Home goods retailer Ikea has acquired U.S.-based logistics technology company Locus to improve its final-mile delivery network.

Third-party logistics provider ATS Logistics Services has agreed to acquire the brokerage operations of Trailer Bridge.

The September Logistics Managers’ Index signaled a negative freight inversion for the second month in a row.

Old Dominion Freight Line was named as the top national carrier for a 16th straight year by Mastio & Co.

Morgan Stanley lowered earnings expectations for publicly traded truckload and less-than-truckload carriers on Monday.

FedEx Corp. has completed the formation of the leadership team for a standalone FedEx Freight.

Trimac Transportation announced it has acquired Houston-based chemical hauler Service Transport Company.

Expedited carriers C&M Transport and Barrett Directline have entered a merger agreement.

Paschall Truck Lines’ parent Interstate Personnel Services is looking to add temperature-controlled capabilities to its network with the acquisition of J&R Schugel.

ArcBest talks up numbers at its first investor day since 2015.

Rose Rocket announced Monday that it has acquired Toronto-based technology provider Centro.

AI adoption and data center buildouts have warehouse tenants fretting over energy infrastructure.

Supply chain services provider TIG has agreed to acquire food-grade logistics provider PDM.

Susquehanna analyst Bascome Majors cut earnings forecasts on truckload carriers for the rest of the year as fundamentals remain soft and peak-season expectations are subdued.

Less-than-truckload carrier Dayton Freight Lines announced it has doubled capacity at a terminal serving the Salem, Illinois market.

FedEx Freight’s spinoff is on track to be completed by June of next year.

The Cass Freight Index showed year-over-year shipment declines widened in August.

Yellow Corp. lost an appeal to circumvent the 2021 pension bailout regulations used to calculate its withdrawal liabilities.

BWT Logistics has acquired RAZR Logistics, adding on-demand warehousing to its services.

Yellow Corp. has reached a deal to sell a Baltimore terminal, leaving only 11 locations remaining for sale.

Radiant Logistics’ fiscal fourth quarter results came in ahead of analysts’ expectations.

Truckload carrier Werner Enterprises said it’s seeing “positive momentum” in its dedicated and logistics businesses at an investor conference this week.

ArcBest lowered third-quarter margin expectations for its asset-based unit, which includes less-than-truckload operations.

Freight broker FitzMark announced it has acquired Hometown Logistics.

Less-than-truckload carrier Dayton Freight reaches further east with its latest terminal opening.

Logistics Plus announced the acquisition of Chicago-based freight brokerage LoadDelivered Logistics.

Less-than-truckload carrier Saia saw tonnage move back into negative territory in August as the manufacturing complex nears a third full year of contraction.

Old Dominion Freight Line reported Thursday that tonnage declines accelerated in August.

Descartes missed fiscal second-quarter expectations Wednesday after the market closed.

Less-than-truckload carrier XPO’s third-quarter update showed a notable moderation in tonnage declines during August.

Radiant Logistics announced it has taken an 80% stake in Weport, a Mexico-based transportation and logistics provider.

Yellow’s equipment auctions conclude after nearly two years.

Sentiment among supply chain managers regarding transportation capacity and pricing signaled a cooling freight market in August.

Payables automation platform BravoTran announced the addition of receivables capabilities with the acquisition of Keystroke.io.

Infrastructure investment firm Stonepeak has acquired two logistics centers in Fort Worth, Texas.

Prologis Mobility and EV Realty are collaborating to increase electric truck charging capabilities across California.

J.B. Hunt Transport Services promotes Brad Delco to chief financial officer.

Cold storage provider Lineage announced Thursday that its facility at the Port of New Orleans now offers bonded warehouse space in addition to USDA inspections.
meta_description: Based in Richmond, VA, Todd is the finance editor at FreightWaves. Prior to joining FreightWaves, he covered the TLs, LTLs, railroads and brokers for RBC Capital Markets and BB&T Capital Markets.
